main event: Six lighted objects, approximately 3 times the size of lights on usual aircraft, in various colors (white, blue, purple, and orange) were observed at the USN Weather Station in Kodiak, Alaska on October 25, 1957.
interesting points: The objects moved in spurts, hovering then moving.
The objects' lights varied in intensity.
The objects' movement was described as 'zig-zagging'.
The objects were observed for 10 minutes.
The report concludes the objects were likely natural phenomena, such as balloons, and not aircraft or astronomical objects.
sighted object: six lighted objects, approximately 3 times the size of lights on usual aircraft
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
